snippet: A finding by safety investigators showed that the TransAsia flight’s pilots discussed shutting down the functioning engine, not the one that had triggered a cockpit alarm.
abstract: Investigators looking into crash of TransAsia Airways Flight 235 in Taipei, Taiwan, say pilots may have shut down wrong engine after receiving stalled-engine alarm; findings represent preliminary estimation from plane's cockpit voice and flight data recordings, not final conclusion.
lead_paragraph: A finding by safety investigators showed that the TransAsia flight’s pilots discussed shutting down the functioning engine, not the one that had triggered a cockpit alarm.

headline.main: Pilots in Crash May Have Shut Wrong Engine, Finding Suggests
headline.print_headline: Pilots in Crash May Have Shut Wrong Engine, Finding Suggests
